articles.title: Congratulations to Mongolian People's Party
articles.content:
Congratulations to Mongolian People's Party
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Monday sent a congratulatory message to the 28th Congress of the Mongolian People's Party.
					 The message expressed the belief that the congress would mark an important occasion in the efforts of the Mongolian People's Party to strengthen itself and achieve the independent and democratic development of the country.
					
					 It wished the MPP big success in its 28th congress, hoping that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties would steadily develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Special Envoy of General Secretary of C.C., CPC Leaves
articles.content:
Special Envoy of General Secretary of C.C., CPC Leaves
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Song Tao, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China who is a special envoy of Xi Jinping, general secretary of the C.C., CPC, and his party left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: Song Tao Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Song Tao Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Song Tao, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China who is a special envoy of Xi Jinping, general secretary of the C.C., CPC, and his party visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 The guests paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders reflecting the profound reverence of the Korean people and progressive mankind the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 Song Tao wrote in the visitor's book, "We express deep yearning for Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the great leaders of the Korean people and close friends of the Chinese people."

articles.title: Song Tao Lays Floral Basket at Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Song Tao Lays Floral Basket at Friendship Tower
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Song Tao, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) who is a special envoy of Xi Jinping, general secretary of the C.C., CPC, laid a floral basket at the Friendship Tower on Sunday.
					 Present at the floral basket-laying ceremony were the special envoy's party and Li Jinjun, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Placed at the tower were floral baskets in the names of the special envoy of the general secretary of the C.C., CPC and others.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers before going round the tower.
					
					 Then, they visited the Songhung Revolutionary Site in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province and laid floral baskets at the cemetery of martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers there.

articles.title: Special Envoy of General Secretary of C.C., CPC Tours Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
articles.content:
Special Envoy of General Secretary of C.C., CPC Tours Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Song Tao, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China who is a special envoy of Xi Jinping, general secretary of the C.C., CPC, and his party visited Mangyongdae Revolutionary School.
					 Being briefed on the fact that the school has developed into a reliable pedigree establishment for training hard-core backbones for carrying forward the lineage of the Juche revolution, the guests toured the revolutionary museum, gymnasium, swimming pool and other parts of the school.
					
					 They also toured the Ryuwon Footwear Factory, etc.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests, including delegations and delegates of Juche idea study organizations from different countries, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Child Health Day Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
Child Health Day Marked in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday to mark the Child Health Day.
					 It was attended by officials from the Ministry of Public Health and relevant units, members of missions of international bodies including the UNICEF and WHO, and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 At the event speakers noted that the work to prevent pediatric disease is brisk throughout the world.
					
					 Saying that preventive inoculations are of weighty significance in bringing up children to be health, they stressed the need to boost immunity.
					
					 Then followed a lecture on the intake of vitamin A, vital to the children's health, and the preventive treatment of various diseases.
					
					 On the same day, there were diverse medical services aimed at protecting and promoting the health of children under 5 in Pyongyang and local areas.

articles.title: Landscapes of Koguryo, Cultural Heritage of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Landscapes of Koguryo, Cultural Heritage of Korean Nation
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The cultural heritages of the Korean nation well-known over the world include landscapes created in the period of Koguryo (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					 As they give a clear glimpse of the pictorial development in the period of Koguryo, they come to be a precious national treasure which contributed to the cultural development of the world.
					
					 Typical of them is tomb murals in Phyongjong-ri, Anak County of South Hwanghae Province, which is believed to be made in the 4th century.
					
					 Seen on the eastern wall of the chamber is the perspective representation of scenery of Mt Wolam surrounding the tomb area and on its western wall peaks of Mt Kuwol laying range after range.
					
					 The 5th century had witnessed further development of landscape painting in Koguryo as shown by mural paintings in Jangchon Tomb No. 1 and the contents of landscapes got diversified in the 6th-7th century.
					
					 In particular, a pine tree drawn on the northern wall of Jinpha-ri Tomb No. 1 has been appraised as the peculiar and admirable painting.
					
					 Now, tomb murals of Koguryo have been well preserved, adding glory to the superiority of the Korean nation, thanks to the culture conservation policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Concrete-Mixture Pressure Pump Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Concrete-Mixture Pressure Pump Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The Rakwon Machine Complex in the DPRK has developed a concrete-mixture pressure pump with its own efforts and technology.
					The pump, 5,800 kg in weight, can shoot concrete-mixture up to the height of 350 meters and to the distance of 1,600 meters.
					
					 Its performance efficiency has been proved through several load trials at construction sites.
					
					 Now, the complex is making full preparations for its serial production.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Military Moves
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Military Moves
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are getting hell-bent on military provocations targeting the DPRK.
					 On Nov. 11 and 12 the Japan Maritime "Self-Defense Force" staged large-scale joint military drills in league with U.S. nuclear aircraft carrier task forces.
					
					 Japan Defense Minister Onodera, commenting on the drills involving USS Ronald Reagan, Theodore Roosevelt and Nimitz, and MSDF's escort warships Ise, Makinami and Inazma, said "the drills were effective ones which clearly showed the strong will of Japan and the U.S."
					
					 Meanwhile, Japan is stepping up the deployment of the new type missile defense system Aegis Ashore in Akita and Yamaguchi prefectures under the pretext of coping with ballistic missiles of the DPRK.
					
					 It is about to import SM-3 and F-35As and warships equipped with an Aegis combat system from the U.S., according to a report from the recent press conference jointly held by Trump and Abe.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that the Japanese reactionaries, buckling down to realizing their wild ambition for launching an overseas invasion, have gone beyond the red line in their risky military moves.
					
					 Japan seeks to secure a pretext for deploying its SDF troops on the Korean peninsula under the excuse of "threat" from the DPRK and thus bring into reality its old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" by justifying its reinvasion of the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 This is just the invariable wild ambition being sought by the reactionaries of Japan.
					
					 Although over seven decades have passed since Japan's defeat, the Japan militarists' wild ambition has never changed but is being revived by their descendents.
					
					 The present ruling quarters of Japan put into force the "security law" in March 2016, thus providing the SDF with the power to exercise "the right of collective self-defense" and dramatically expanding the sphere of the SDF's overseas activities.
					
					 They have modeled Japan on fascism in haste by instituting a series of evil laws like those on protecting specified secrets and punishing organized crimes. Recently, they are busy pushing ahead with the scenario for retrogressively revising the existing Constitution as a final phase for realizing its wild ambition for overseas invasion.
					
					 Japan is crazy about the joint military drills with the main forces of the U.S. imperialist aggression army to be involved in the future Korean war deployed on its mainland, terming the DPRK's entirely just measures for self-defense "threats." This is just war hysteria to ignite a fresh Korean war in league with the U.S.
					
					 However, it will be good for Japan not to run wild, obsessed with megalomania.
					
					 Japan itself will not be safe once a war breaks out on the Korean peninsula. Everything of Japan to be involved in the war may disappear at once together with the U.S. military bases in Japan.
					
					 Japan's crazy ride on a militarist chariot will only make it fall into a pitfall of ruin.

articles.title: War Servants Will Face Bitter Disgrace: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
War Servants Will Face Bitter Disgrace: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- These days in the wake of Trump's junket to south Korea its authorities are running high fever in introducing latest weapons of the U.S. and developing military equipment.
					 The chief executive of south Korea when meeting Trump on Nov. 7 agreed to import U.S. latest military equipment worth 13 billion US dollars in three years and in return for it the U.S. agreed to lift the restriction on the weight of ballistic missile warhead.
					
					 According to the agreement, the south Korean authorities are vociferous that they would actively examine the additional introduction of latest supervisory equipment, which they demanded at the 49th U.S.-south Korea annual security consultative meeting in October, and Stealth F-35A fighters, Grey Eagle drones and SM-3 naval interceptor missiles for Aegis destroyer which would strike at nuclear and missile bases of the DPRK in contingency.
					
					 This is the dangerous military confrontation racket aggravating the tense situation on the Korean peninsula and disturbing peace and stability of the region.
					
					 It is the sinister intention of the U.S. to sell more weapons to south Korea under the pretence of "threat from the north" and equip south Korea with U.S. weapons and use it as shock brigade in a nuclear war against the north.
					
					 The U.S. in the 1950s supplied latest weapons to the war servants of south Korea for the fratricidal war. Even now heavyweights of the U.S. not taking care of its face as "only superpower" make frantic trips aimed at encouraging its junior "allies" to the moves for a war.
					
					 It is the domestic and foreign estimation that the U.S. has no force to threaten and blackmail the DPRK any longer.
					
					 Nevertheless, poor colonial servants of the U.S. fill the purse of the American munitions monopoly plutocrats and actively join in the moves of the U.S. master for a war of aggression with a huge amount of money collected from the people as tax to curry favor with stingy trader and warmonger Trump.
					
					 The south Korean authorities obsessed with pro-U.S. sycophancy are busy introducing U.S. made weapons and developing arms equipment to counter the DPRK, Juche nuclear power and world-class military power. This is as foolish an act as precipitating self-destruction.
					
					 Only bitter disgrace awaits the war servants depending on the tired U.S. master.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should behave themselves, clearly seeing the catastrophic results to be entailed by their reckless arms buildup.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint War Exercises Flayed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint War Exercises Flayed
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces staged war exercises simulating a preemptive attack on the DPRK after hurling huge naval forces including Aegis destroyers of the puppet navy as well as the three nuclear carrier strike groups like Ronald Reagan, Theodore Roosevelt and Nimitz. They called the saber-rattling "maximum military pressure" and "most strong message".
					 A commentary of Rodong Sinmun Monday brands the exercises as an adventurous act of the senseless war fanatics and a deliberate military provocation further increasing the danger of a war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Moreover, the U.S. started combined naval exercises with the Japan Maritime "Self-Defense Force" before the joint naval drills with the puppet forces, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the first time the U.S. deployed the three nuclear carrier strike groups in the waters off the Korean peninsula and staged the DPRK-targeted joint military exercises with Japan's MSDF and the puppet navy.
					
					 The U.S. act of amassing war hardware in the waters off the Korean peninsula and hurling its vassal forces including south Korea into the largest-ever joint naval exercises proves that the U.S. bellicose attempt to bring down the DPRK by force has gone beyond the danger line.
					
					 The U.S. has got hell-bent on staging war exercises against the DPRK, threatening it with nuclear carriers. But this is just an extension of the confrontation outbursts made by Trump in south Korea and a hysteria of thoughtless losers who are at a loss what to do, being taken aback by the single-minded unity of the people in the DPRK and its tremendous military power.
					
					 The U.S. and the puppet warmongers should not run amuck, clearly understanding that they will only face tragic end beyond prediction and imagination from the military confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Calls for Detaining Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Calls for Detaining Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The "Commando for Seizing MB" of south Korea released a statement on Nov. 15 urging the authorities to detain traitor Lee Myung Bak immediately, according to south Korean internet newspaper Voice of Seoul.
					 Noting that the public calls for detaining Lee, a kingpin of irregularities, the statement said he should make an apology to the public and be punished for his crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Racket of "Human Rights in North" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Racket of "Human Rights in North" under Fire
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea on Nov. 16 held the 1145th Thursday rally in Seoul, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 Speakers at the rally said the south Korean authorities have no qualification to talk about human rights as the rights of prisoners of conscience and women citizens of the north are violated in south Korea.
					
					 The recent "resolution on human rights in the north" cooked up at the UN General Assembly is a product of the plots hatched by the U.S., EU, Japan and the present south Korean regime, they charged.
					
					 They demanded that the present authorities send back the detained women citizens of the north before talking about "human rights performance" in the north.
					
					 They also urged the "government" to set free the prisoners of conscience within this year.

articles.title: S. Korean Progressive Organizations Indict Traitor Lee Myung Bak for His Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean Progressive Organizations Indict Traitor Lee Myung Bak for His Crimes
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic organizations including the Solidarity of Justice for Correct History, the Headquarters of All-People Action to Punish Lee Myung Bak and the "Commando for Seizing MB" held a press conference outside the puppet National Police Agency on Nov. 17, indicting traitor Lee Myung Bak for his crimes.
					 The organizations said that Lee Myung Bak suppressed human rights of the people and interfered in "state affairs".
					
					 The prosecution backed Lee Myung Bak's meddling in the "state affairs" and the special inspection shielded his crimes to elect him as "president", they noted.
					
					 They stressed the need for the police to strictly investigate Lee Myung Bak, swindle and corruption suspect, and punish him, stop behaving like the corrupt prosecution distrusted by the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Health Workers Union Calls for Combating Evils
articles.content:
S. Korean Health Workers Union Calls for Combating Evils
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The health workers union of south Korea held press conferences on Nov. 16 in demand of rooting out evils rampant in hospitals, according to Jaju Sibo, an internet newspaper of south Korea.
					 Saying that such evils as wage differentials, sexual abuses and bullying acts are rampant in hospitals, speakers urged the regime to take a step for tackling them.
					
					 They declared that they would launch an all-people movement to combat the evils.

articles.title: Probing Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster Called for
articles.content:
Probing Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster Called for
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The Consultative Council of Families of Victims of April 16 Ferry Sewol Disaster and the April 16 Solidarity in south Korea held a press conference on Nov. 15 to demand the puppet National Assembly pass the bill for amendment of special law for probing the truth behind the ferry Sewol sinking, south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo said.
					 In the press release the organizations said that the people would never allow the act of making the bill for amendment of special law a negotiation card and using it as political means.

articles.title: Representative of LKP under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Representative of LKP under Fire in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Hong Jun Phyo, representative of the "Liberal Korea Party", was indicted on Nov. 16 by the Solidarity for People's Sovereignty, a civic organization of south Korea, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 The organization held a press conference outside the Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office to denounce Hong Jun Phyo for branding the present "government" and the staff of Chongwadae as a "group of Juche idea followers" and "left-wing followers of the north".
					
					 The press release called for detention and serious punishment upon Hong.

articles.title: Trump Hit for Insulting Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership
articles.content:
Trump Hit for Insulting Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Trump during his visit to south Korea slandered the dignity of the supreme leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, daring say that he came to the Korean peninsula to convey his message to someone.
					 A commentary of Rodong Sinmun Monday says an insult to the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK is the biggest insult to its army and people and an intolerable challenge to human mentality and conscience.
					
					 Trump must clearly understand that his rubbish is leading the U.S., to say nothing of himself, to irretrievable road to the hell, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 It is a stark reality that the old and ailing U.S. is heading toward the hell.
					
					 The mentally deranged money-grabber dared point his finger at the sun. This has made him the criminal who is sentenced to death by the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 Those who challenge the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and its social system can never find their place to live under this sky. Rabid dog Trump will certainly be made to pay dearly for his hideous crime.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Posted on Mexican Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Posted on Mexican Website
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's brief biography was posted on the Mexican website Friends of Korea on Nov. 15 with the approach of the sixth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- A Russian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Moscow on Nov. 13.
					 Victor Petrov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting and book exhibition on the sixth anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Ukraine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Ukraine
Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Kiev on Nov. 12.
					 Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il and hold political and cultural events such as a remembrance meeting, book and photo exhibition and film show on the sixth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: CC de PTC felicita 28o Congreso de PPM
articles.content:
CC de PTC felicita 28o Congreso de PPM
Pyongyang, 20 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea remitio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al 28o Congreso del Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia.
					La misiva expresa la seguridad de que el conclave sera un hito importante en las actividades del PPM por lograr el fortalecimiento del partido y el desarrollo independiente y democratico del pais.
					
					Convencida de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos seguiran desarrollandose favorablemente de acuerdo con los intereses de los pueblos de dos paises, formulo sinceros votos por mayores exitos en las labores del 28o Congreso del PPM.

articles.title: Regresan Song Tao y su comitiva
articles.content:
Regresan Song Tao y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 20 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Regresaron el dia 20 Song Tao, jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh quien es el enviado especial de Xi Jinping, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, y su comitiva.

articles.title: Song Tao y su comitiva rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Song Tao y su comitiva rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 20 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Song Tao, jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China quien es el enviado especial de Xi Jinping, Secretario General del CC de PCCh, y su comitiva visitaron el 19 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Los huespedes expresaron homenaje postumo al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de pie y en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos.
					
					Ellos pasaron revista a la sala de conservacion de las ordenes que reflejan el ferviente sentimiento de elogio y adoracion del pueblo coreano y la humanidad progresista a los grandes Lideres y las salas de autos, carro electrico, barco y vagones de tren, usados por esos grandes hombres hasta el ultimo periodo de su vida para las visitas de orientacion sobre el terreno y los viajes al extranjero.
					
					Song Tao dejo en el libro de visitantes las letras: "Expreso gran anoranza al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, grandes lideres del pueblo coreano y amigos intimos del pueblo chino".

articles.title: Enviado especial chino y su comitiva en Escuela Revolucionaria de Mangyondae
articles.content:
Enviado especial chino y su comitiva en Escuela Revolucionaria de Mangyondae
Pyongyang, 20 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Song Tao, jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China quien es el enviado especial de Xi Jinping, Secretario General del CC del PCCh, y su comitiva visitaron la Escuela Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae.
					Recorrieron el museo, el gimnasio polivalente, la piscina y otros puntos escuchando las explicaciones de que esa institucion docente se ha desarrollado como centro de formacion de los pilares de la revolucion del Juche.
					
					Ellos estuvieron tambien en la Fabrica de Calzados Ryuwon y otros lugares.

articles.title: Se efectua acto dedicado al Dia de la Salud de Ninos
articles.content:
Se efectua acto dedicado al Dia de la Salud de Ninos
Pyongyang, 20 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 20 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto dedicado al Dia de la Salud de Ninos.
					Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios del Ministerio de Salud Publica y las unidades vinculadas, los miembros de las representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales como el Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF) y la representacion de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS), y los integrantes de las embajadas de varios paises, acreditados en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion, los oradores se refirieron a que en muchos paises y regiones del mundo se activan los esfuerzos por prevenir las enfermedades infantiles.
					
					Recalcaron que la vacunacion preventiva tiene gran importancia en la cria sana de los ninos y destacaron la necesidad de dinamizar las actividades por el plan de amplificacion de la inmunidad.
					
					Acto seguido, se impartio la conferencia sobre la absorcion de la vitamina A, imprescindible para la salud de ninos, y el tratamiento preventivo de varias enfermedades.
					
					Este dia, se realizaron en la ciudad de Pyongyang y otras localidades las asistencias medicas para proteger y fomentar la salud de ninos de menos de 5 anos de edad.
